Twenty-two years ago, our country was changed forever. Today, we honor the heroes who answered the call and remember those we lost. 

Please join me in praying for the families who lost loved ones on this tragic day. We will #NeverForget.

It was great to be with the @CatawbaChamber this week for some Q&A and to provide an update from Washington. 

Thanks to Chamber President Lindsay Keisler for putting together such a wonderful event and Board Chair Zack Cranford for hosting us at City Walk Brewing & Distilling.

It was great to visit @appstate‚Äôs new campus in Hickory this week. This wonderful facility welcomed students for the Fall Semester in August and is a fantastic addition to Catawba County and #NC10. I look forward to watching App State‚Äôs continued growth here in Hickory.

Thanks to CEO Dave Regnery and his executive leadership team for hosting me at Trane Technologies in Davidson. 

I appreciated the discussion on tax, trade, and intellectual property policy and its impact on a manufacturing leader here in the Tenth District.

In recognition of #NationalPreparednessMonth, I visited the EnergyUnited dispatch center to see their investment in technology that will ensure they are prepared to execute emergency response during a major outage.

Thank you to the EnergyUnited team for hosting me.

Yesterday, I had the opportunity to speak with the @SVLChamber to provide an update on my work in Washington & speak on the importance of our fight against the #CCP.
Thanks to Shannon Viera & William Morgan for hosting me and to all who attended to advocate for their community.

Thanks to @ClubTotl for inviting me to be your guest speaker last week. I enjoyed providing an update on my work this Congress & taking questions on the pressing issues our country is facing.

Congrats to the new board on being sworn in & thanks for your service to the community.

Thanks to Skip Steele, Tracy Barger, & Haywood Easter for showing me the new Amy's House. The finished product will be an outstanding facility to shelter victims of domestic violence.

Thanks to the Lincoln County Coalition Against Domestic Violence team for your selfless work!

Thanks to Erica Batounis for giving me for a tour of Active Concepts in Lincolnton. Active Concepts produces raw materials for the personal care & cosmetic industries and is thriving in Lincoln County.

After previously touring construction of the new @LincolnCountyNC Courthouse, it was great to see the finished product. This facility is a tremendous asset to our community & I am grateful for the community leaders that made it happen. Thanks to Davin Madden for hosting me.

Thanks to the Lincolnton-Lincoln County Chamber of Commerce for hosting me for a Washington update. We discussed our fight against the #CCP, my work on the @FinancialCmte, & more.

It was great to visit Ore-Bank Pumpkin Center VFD to celebrate their recent Assistance to Firefighters Grant award. 

This grant was used to install an exhaust removal system for the station. Thanks to Chief Steve Goggio and his team for their service to our community.

Thanks to Chief Tim Tench & his team for giving me a tour of East Lincoln Fire Department Station #3. This tremendous new facility provides first responders with the tools to serve the growing East Lincoln community. Thanks to the East Lincoln FD for keeping our community safe.

Thank you to Burke County Commission Vice Chair Jeff Brittain, Commissioner Johnnie Carswell & Manager Brian Epley for taking time to meet with me this week. It was great to hear more about the initiatives & programs the county is undertaking to move the community forward.

I enjoyed visiting @unch_blue this week.  It was great to see firsthand how they serve our community and the impressive new tower under construction. Thanks to CEO Kathy Bailey and the entire UNC Health Blue Ridge team for all they do for the region.

It was wonderful to tour the Phifer Family YMCA in Morganton yesterday. The Y is a welcome addition to Burke County, and I appreciate the many impactful initiatives they are undertaking to strengthen our community.

I enjoyed the dialogue with @TheBurkeChamber over lunch yesterday. I am honored to serve #WNC in Congress & appreciate the contribution these community leaders make to our entire region. Thanks to Chamber President Tonia Stephenson & chamber staff for hosting this great event.

It was wonderful to visit @WPCC_Pioneers yesterday & tour the new Regional Skilled Trades Solutions Center. This facility is home to WPCC‚Äôs Building Construction & Technology program & will serve our entire region as a training hub. Thanks to President Dr. Joel Welch & his team!

Congrats to Iredell County Sheriff Darren Campbell on being sworn in as President of the North Carolina Sheriffs‚Äô Association. Sheriff Campbell does tremendous work to keep his county safe and our state will benefit from his leadership.
